alert.note: Alert for Eastern Chester; Western Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 2:55PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Chester County through 330 PM EDT... At 255 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lionville, or 9 miles northwest of West Chester, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... West Chester, Phoenixville, Coatesville, Downingtown, Glenmoore, Chester Springs, Lionville, Marshallton, Lionville-Marchwood, West Goshen, Spring City, Malvern, South Coatesville, Modena, Exton and Thorndale. This includes Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 304 and 319. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
